item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Alzheimer's Study Shows Ketone Bodies Help Clear Misfolded Proteins (32 points | 4 comments)
2. From where I left (765 points | 271 comments)
3. GM exits robotaxi market, will bring Cruise operations in house (167 points | 178 comments)
4. Electric (Postgres sync engine) BETA release (55 points | 8 comments)
5. The Google Willow Thing (473 points | 213 comments)

7. Launch HN: Double (YC W24) – Index Investing with 0% Expense Ratios (306 points | 350 comments)
8. Bryan Johnson – The Most Expensive Eating Disorder (55 points | 28 comments)
9. U.S. math scores drop on major international test (199 points | 377 comments)
10. Running Durable Workflows in Postgres Using DBOS (111 points | 28 comments)
11. Watch carved from meteorite that hit Earth a million years ago (7 points | 1 comment)
12. The Albuquerque "Broken Arrow" Nuclear Accident (28 points | 5 comments)
13. Training LLMs to Reason in a Continuous Latent Space (177 points | 57 comments)
14. Boltzmann brain (77 points | 71 comments)

20. Ask HN: Those making $500/month on side projects in 2024 – Show and tell (338 points | 383 comments)
21. The Depths of Wikipedians (151 points | 51 comments)
22. Digital consumption keeps me from getting better at my job (201 points | 73 comments)
23. Colour in the Middle Ages (107 points | 63 comments)
24. WPEngine, Inc. vs. Automattic– Order on Motion for Preliminary Injunction (143 points | 50 comments)
25. Show HN: Holos – Configure Kubernetes with CUE data structures instead of YAML (49 points | 22 comments)
26. Google says AI weather model masters 15-day forecast (125 points | 108 comments)
27. AMD's trusted execution environment blown wide open by new BadRAM attack (109 points | 24 comments)
28. Show HN: Hyperbrowser – Scalable Browser Infrastructure for AI Apps (28 points | 20 comments)
29. From Unemployment to Lisp: Running GPT-2 on a Teen's Deep Learning Compiler (94 points | 2 comments)
30. Arctic tundra is now emitting more carbon than it absorbs, US agency says (76 points | 17 comments)
